Title: Hyperion Systems Administrator / Minx Admin Developer
Description: * *  *   Primary Responsibilities.*   *    Manage the day-to-day technical administration of the Oracle Hyperion Financial Management (HFM) Platform*     Ensure compliance with appropriate Federal and contractual policies, procedures, and controls within Oracle Hyperion HFM and related processes; oversee timely support and issue resolution, most critically during the accounting closed and financial planning cycles; maintain outlines, metadata, business rules, scripts, and other objects within Oracle Hyperion HFM as business requirements change and migrate objects across environments; apply patches to the Hyperion application*     Assist in the analysis, design, and development of new reports and system enhancements; and create and maintain Oracle Hyperion HFM interfaces and automation.*     Become familiar with all aspects of the application, including reports, parameters, business functions, intake, testing, and deployment processes, and interface controls and programming.*     Establish experience of the business to identify enhancement and efficiency opportunities to the HFM technology suite and proactively take the steps necessary to see them through to Production.*     Manage operations and end-user support of Hyperion FMS 11.2x platform: HFM, FDMEE, Planning, Workforce Planning, EssBase, and Financial Reports.*     Ensure smooth month-end, quarterly and annual close, consolidation, reporting, and forecast/budget cycles through close partnership with Finance and IT business partners.*     Observe and monitor the operational performance of assigned applications and proactively maintain nominal operational effectiveness.*     Perform appropriate maintenance activities for all Finance system solutions including managing data hierarchies.*     Monitor and manage data integration feeds and processing activities and resolve issues in different environments.*     Provide primary technical support and take responsibility for on-call support, research & development, and technical assistance. While on-call, the incumbent must have the ability to receive calls and text messages after hours and on weekends.*     Take the lead in business continuity and disaster recovery for the Hyperion environments, including disaster recovery testing, data backups and recover, and updating/maintaining disaster recovery policies and procedures.*     Take the lead in supporting analysis and recommendations to migrate HFM to the cloud.*     Prepare documentation for assigned projects and complete the paperwork necessary to release the project.*     Support integrated releases and production deployments.*   *    Education and Experience*   *    Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Accounting Information System, or engineering or technically related field, preferred.*     8 Years’ experience*   *    Basic Qualifications*    Experience writing well-designed, testable, efficient code in HTML5, CSS, PHP, Bootstrap, PowerShell, Java, and/or JavaScript.*     Experience or understanding Hyperion product migration methods and technologies.*     Experience with Oracle, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, MySQL databases.*     Experience with software engineering best practices (e.g., code reviews, design documentation, unit testing).*     Experience working in a UNIX/Linux/Windows environment, working in an agile development environment, experience with SharePoint, ServiceNow, JIRA or similar.*     Hyperion Financial Management, Hyperion Financial Data Management Hyperion Planning, Hyperion Financial Reporting, Hyperion Workspace, Hyperion Performance Architect, Hyperion Performance Management, Hyperion Production Reporting (SQR)*     OBIEE, OAS, Oracle Reports. SmartView, Visual Explorer.*     Java, J2EE, CFML, PL/SQL, JSP, XML, JMS, Shell Script, PERL, CFML, ASP, EJB, JavaScript, MaxL, ESSBASE, XML 1.0, C, C++, Proc* C.*     Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL*     Ability to conduct independent research to lead or support the resolution of complex questions and issues.*     Demonstrable personal accomplishments and experience (5+ years) with performing Oracle Hyperion Financial Management systems administration.*     Experience developing and maintaining HFM objects including Web forms, business rules, member lists, data grids, journal entry and task flows.*     Experience managing and troubleshooting data integration issues through research and troubleshooting designed to rapidly address issues.*     Writing HFM business rules using VBScript and developing custom automation processes using PowerShell script/Unit Shell script.*     Generating Task and Data Audit reports out of the HFM and ensuring adherence to audit controls and providing evidence in audit walkthroughs.*     3 years’ experience with operational financial reporting, corporate finance forecasting, budgeting and/or planning experience, preferably with Federal Financial Management Improvement Act compliant accounting systems.*     Experience performing preventive and perfective administration activities including database backups; recovery; optimization and performance tuning.*     Demonstrable personal accomplishments and experience (5+ years) with using open-source tools and projects.*   *    Skill Needs*    Have previous experience of FDMEE (Oracle Financial Data Management Enterprise Edition)*     Have previous administrator experience on Oracle Hyperion (Oracle Enterprise Performance Management, aka EPM)*     Hyperion/FMS Business administration include Metadata maintenance, Deployment of application, adding new entities, maintaining Hierarchies and Managing and approving user access.*     Hyperion/FMS creation of data forms, data grids, process management, task workflows, journal entry, and consolidation.*     Strong Analytical Skill for Data Transformation, Data Extraction, and Data Loading (ETL).*     Have previous experience with GTAS and government accounting*     Ability to lead new development and maintain existing Hyperion Financial Management Applications and customizations.*     Working knowledge of Data Relationship Manager (DRM) and Hyperion Planning.*     Knowledge of general ledger systems.*     Ability to interface with IT and business users to quickly correct problems and develop solutions.*   * * *

Title: Wireless Network Engineer (Onsite)
Description: * Title : Wireless Network Engineer* Location : Lehi, UTAH* Duration : 12+ Months* Rate : $11,000 Per Month on 1099* Onsite from Day One, 4 days onsite-1 day can work Remote* Requirements: * - Experience managing Cisco Wireless APs and Wireless LAN Controllers* · current wireless standards include: 5508/5520/9800 Wireless LAN Controllers, 3800/4800/9130 Wireless APs* - WLAN troubleshooting experience (some LAN experience also preferred)* - Familiar with 802.11ac or newer wireless standards* - Wireless network survey / deploy / operate & troubleshooting skills (with emphasis on deploy and operate and troubleshoot)* - Nice to have: Pre / post site survey experience* Expectations of Role: * - Ability to troubleshoot wireless performance/throughput issues via packet capture and work and close out service tickets* - Replace defective equipment* - Upgrade firmware/wireless code and do configuration changes on Wireless LAN controllers* - Leverage experience to identify wireless inefficiencies and help implement changes and new wireless standards* - Business Hours Support – 8AM – 5PM Local time 5 days a week and report to an Adobe IT manager, no overtime or after hours work written in contract.* - Adtandard communication protocols (email, phone, Slack).* Thanks and Regards,* Narendra Datta | Senior Executive-TAG | Kairos Technologies.* Job Type: Contract* Pay: $10,500.00 - $11,000.00 per hour* Schedule:* 8 hour shift* Ability to commute/relocate:* Lehi, UT: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred)* Experience:* Wireless: 3 years (Required)*  SD WAN: 3 years (Required)* Security clearance:* Confidential (Preferred)* Work Location: One location*

Title: Statistical Programmer II - Remote
Description: Come join the Parexel Statistical Programmer team today!**The Statistical Programmer II provides technical expertise for the conduct of clinical trials, and works with*minimal supervision to support various programming activities related to the analysis and reporting of*clinical study data. In addition, the Statistical Programmer II may fill the Statistical Programming Lead role*(or part of that role) on small, non-complex projects. Qualifications Qualifications:*Excellent analytical skills.*Proficiency in SAS.*Knowledge and understanding of the programming and reporting process.*Knowledge of SOPs/Guidelines, ICH-GCP, and any other applicable local and international**regulations such as 21 CFR Part 11.*Ability to learn new systems and function in an evolving technical environment.*Ability to manage competing priorities and flexibility to change.*Attention to detail.*Ability to successfully work as part of a global team.*Work effectively in a quality-focused environment.*Effective time management in order to meet daily metrics or team objectives.*Show commitment to and perform consistently high quality work.*Business/operational skills that include customer focus, commitment to quality management, and**problem solving.*Knowledge and Experience:Competent in written and oral English.*Good communication skills.*Education:Educated to degree level in a relevant discipline and/or equivalent work experience. EEO Disclaimer Parexel is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, which in the US includes race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.*

Title: Senior Revenue Analyst - Opportunity for Working Remotely Sa...
Location: Remote in Salt Lake City, UT 84123
Description: * *  This role is fully remote and can be done in any US state on PT hours.anywhere in the US.*  *   The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?*   This Senior Revenue Analyst position provides a unique opportunity to grow your career by deepening your financial and accounting expertise and providing customer facing opportunities. You will have opportunities to participate in contract negotiations with customers, by presenting data and valuable points of consideration to resolve problems that may impede a successful sales opportunity. This customer experience is critical for anyone with a passion in finance and accounting looking to broaden their business acumen.*   Helping our customers succeed in their digital transformation is a core value at VMware. As part of the Revenue Assurance team you will be surrounded by an organization that believes in VMware’s EPIC2 Values (Execution, Passion, Integrity, Customers, and Community). You will be challenged to think outside the box and grow through close collaboration with the hardworking team in VMware Sales Operations and Management, Legal, and Finance.*  *   What is primary need, technical challenge, and/or problem you will be responsible for? *  The primary need is to support the business throughout contract negotiation through tightened business partnership with cross-functional teams, specifically Deal Management Team. Also, review completed deal review checklists and general revenue documents and contracts. You will be expected to critically evaluate technical accounting conclusions, customer requests and provide well-reasoned solutions to enable management, in coordination with sales, legal, finance and all other cross-function partners, to successfully conclude sales opportunities.*  *   Success in the Role: What are the performance goals over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing? *  Review accounting position of large license agreements and revenue contracts:*   Within 30 days of employment, become competent with VMware’s revenue rules, guidelines, and standard operations.*    You will work closely with DMT and other cross-functional teams to ensure proper compliance with revenue recognition rules and guidelines. You will also ensure proper procedure with local accounting standards specifically, ASC 606 and US GAAP.*    Forecast and properly account for revenue from respective deal negotiations*    Complete compliance reviews, quarterly close activities, and ad-hoc requests*  *   Business partnership:*   Work with key partner teams during contract negotiations on evaluating business cases including the ability to develop & use fallback options.*    Be prepared with and effectively present to your manager, executive leadership, or partner teams any necessary data to draw valid conclusions and resolve problems to help reduce the time until a successful sales opportunity is closed.*    For non-standard deal structures you will review contracts and prepare the revenue accounting position memo and journal entries as needed.*  *   What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis? *  Your regular activities may be modified to suit your professional strengths, but you can expect a variety of the following assignments:*   Prepare checklists, accounting position memos and revenue related journal entries*    Complete Close tasks quarterly*    Review deals pre-booking to support forecasting deliverables*    Manage various queries in the deal inbox*  *   What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?*   You will be joining the Revenue Assurance team. The 100+ person Revenue Assurance Team is comprised of Revenue Analysts, Managers, Accountants, Operations and Deal Assurance Specialists. The global team is spread throughout VMware offices including Palo Alto, CA, Austin, TX, Cork, IE, and Singapore.*   The team culture is one based on building trust, on-going development through coaching, and giving back to the community through service learning.*  *   What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?*   You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.*   Employee Stock Purchase Plan*    Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types*    Generous Time Off Programs*    40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community*    Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities*    Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)*    Healthy and local inspired snacks in all our on-site pantries*  *   "This job requisition is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsorship by VMware."*   This job may require the candidate to travel and/or work from a facility that requires full vaccination prior to entry.*   Category : FinanceSubcategory: AccountingExperience: Manager and ProfessionalFull Time/ Part Time: Full TimePosted Date: 2022-05-30*   VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.*   Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.* *
